title: How to Post a YouTube Video on Facebook

steps.title: Search for a video on YouTube.
steps.content: Search for a video on YouTube. Enter a video title (or a keyword related to the video you want to share) and press Enter or Return to search. You don't need to log into YouTube unless you plan on linking to an age-restricted YouTube video.

steps.title: Select a video.
steps.content: Select a video. Locate and click the video you wish to post to open the video. You can click the thumbnail image or the title.

steps.title: Click Share.
steps.content: Click Share . This is below the lower-right corner of the video player.

steps.title: Click the Facebook icon.
steps.content: Click the Facebook icon. It's a dark blue block with a white "f" on it. Facebook will open in a new window. If prompted, enter your Facebook login information (your email address and password) before continuing.

steps.title: Enter text for your post.
steps.content: Enter text for your post. If you want to add commentary or other text along with the video, type it into the text field near the top of the post where it says "What's on your mind?" If you don't enter text here, the default text above the post will be the link to the video. You can also use the drop-down menu at the top to select who can see your video. You can select "Public," "Friends", "Friends except," "Specific friends," or "Close Friends."

steps.title: Click Share.
steps.content: Click Share . It's a blue button at the bottom of the new post window. This posts the video to your Facebook timeline. Other users can click the link to open the video on YouTube.

steps.title: Search for a video in the YouTube app.
steps.content: Search for a video in the YouTube app. On your Android, iPhone, or iPad, type in a video title or keyword related to a video, then tap Search or Enter in the keyboard area.

steps.title: Select the video.
steps.content: Select the video. Scroll down until you find the video you want to post, then tap it to open it.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . It's below the video playback screen. It has an icon that resembles a curved arrow pointing right.

steps.title: Tap the Facebook icon.
steps.content: Tap the Facebook icon. It's the dark blue icon with a white "f." For this option to appear, you must have Facebook installed on your phone or tablet . If you don't see the Facebook icon but have the app installed, scroll all the way to the right and tap More to see all available apps on your device. If prompted, allow YouTube permission to post to Facebook, then sign into Facebook with your email address (or phone number) and password to continue.

steps.title: Enter text for your post.
steps.content: Enter text for your post. If you want to add commentary or other text along with the video, type it into the text field that says "What's on your mind?" If you don't enter text here, the default text above the post will be the link to the video. Use the drop-down menu at the top to select who gets to see your video. You can select "Public," "Friends", "Friends except," "Specific friends," or "Close Friends."

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . It's in the top-right corner of the post window. Doing this will post your video's link to Facebook. Other users can select the link to open the video on YouTube.

steps.title: Understand the limitations of this method.
steps.content: Understand the limitations of this method. To post a video to Facebook and have it play on Facebook rather than redirect to YouTube, you'll have to download the video in question and upload it to Facebook . Facebook videos must meet the following criteria: Facebook only allows videos of up to 10 gigabytes and no longer than 240 minutes. Videos should have a resolution of 1080p or less. Use this method only if you or your organization created and owns the copyright to the original video or if you have permission from the copyright owner. Simply adding video credit by adding their name to the Facebook post is unlikely to be good enough.

steps.title: Search for a video on YouTube.
steps.content: Search for a video on YouTube. If you use the mobile app, tap the magnifying glass icon in the upper-right corner to search. On desktop, click the search bar at the top, type the name of a video that you want to download, and press Enter or Return .

steps.title: Select the video you want to post on Facebook.
steps.content: Select the video you want to post on Facebook. Click or tap the video's thumbnail on the results page to open it.

steps.title: Copy the video's address.
steps.content: Copy the video's address. To do so, click or tap Share below the video, then tap Copy link on mobile, or click Copy next to the URL on a computer.

steps.title: Open the Keepvid website.
steps.content: Open the Keepvid website. The Keepvid site allows you to convert YouTube links, such as the one you copied, into MP4 video files, which can then be downloaded. Go to https://www.keepvid.to/ in a new tab. If the Keepvid site is down or not working, check out our guide to downloading YouTube videos in other ways.

steps.title: Paste in your video's address.
steps.content: Paste in your video's address. Click the text box below the "Search video by typing it or paste the video link and hit Go" heading, then press Ctrl + V (PC) or Command + V (Mac). You should see the YouTube link appear in the text box.

steps.title: Download the video.
steps.content: Download the video. Scroll down and click Download next to the video. This will start processing the video, which may take several minutes. Your video will download automatically when it is finished. By default, your downloaded files can be found in your Downloads folder.

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. On mobile, open the Facebook app. On desktop, go to https://www.facebook.com/ in your browser. This will open your Facebook News Feed if you're logged into Facebook. If you aren't logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password, then click Log In .

steps.title: Click or Photo/Video icon.
steps.content: Click or Photo/Video icon. On mobile, it's the green icon to the right of the "What's on your mind?" text field at the top. On desktop, it's the middle button below the "What's on your mind?" text field at the top of the page.

steps.title: Add the video to your post.
steps.content: Add the video to your post. To do so on mobile, tap the video you downloaded. On desktop, drag and drop the video file to the box that says "Add Photos/Videos" in the center of the screen. On mobile, you can post the video as a Reel . To do so, tap Create reel . If you'd rather post the video as a post, tap, '"Create post instead .

steps.title: Add text to your post.
steps.content: Add text to your post. Type whatever text you want to accompany the video into the text field at the top of the post box. This is where you should assign credit (e.g., "Video courtesy of [username]") at the very least. Use the drop-down menu at the top to select who gets to see your video. You can select "Public," "Friends", "Friends except," "Specific friends," or "Close Friends." On mobile, you can also use the drop-down menus at the top to select if you want to post the video to Instagram or Threads.

steps.title: Tap Next (mobile only).
steps.content: Tap Next (mobile only). It's in the upper-right corner. This will take you to a page you can use to schedule your post. If you want to schedule your post, use the drop-down menu below "Scheduling options" to select when the post will go public.

steps.title: Click or tap Post.
steps.content: Click or tap Post . On mobile, it's the blue button in the upper-right corner. On the desktop, there's a blue button at the bottom of the window. Doing so will upload the video to Facebook, though you will have to wait several minutes before the video finishes processing. You and others can view the video by scrolling down to the video post on your profile page and clicking its "Play" button.
